text: Komlavi Loglo (born 30 December 1984) is a professional Togolese tennis player. He was born in Badou, Togo. ==Career== Loglo has spent his career on the Futures circuit, although he has played a handful of Challenger tournaments. He is the top-ranked Togolese player. On March 31, 2008, Komlavi was awarded a Tri-Partite Invitation to compete at the 2008 Summer Olympics singles event in Beijing. He was the first tennis player from Togo to represent his country at the Olympics.ITF Tennis - Olympic Tennis Event - News Article He lost in the first round to South African Kevin Anderson in straight sets. == Equipment == Loglo plays with a Babolat Pure Drive Plus racquet, strung with Babolat Pro Hurricane Tour 17 String.
